definitions.definition: a confused situation in which there is usually a lot of noise and excitement, often involving large numbers of people

examples.text: A tumult of shouting and screaming came from within the house.
They waited for the tumult to die down.

definitions.definition: a state in which your thoughts or feelings are confused

examples.text: He was shaken by the tumult of his feelings.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French tumulte or Latin tumultus.
